messages.message: So it’s a two step process, you needed to accept the invite so I could then privilege you. I just sent over the privs now, so you should be able to access the SMS sub org now as a support user and see the logs.
As a note to you and Heymian we have burned through another $100 in SMS since I last chatted with Heymian so it’s definitely sending messages at least some of the time.
@Heymian that means we’ve got at most $200 left on the account so we’ll need to figure out at least an initial stab at what I need to submit to Zip.
I tried logging in again, it didn't send 2FA message to me. username:anantb email:<mailto:anantb@instabase.com|anantb@instabase.com>
I saw a lot of undelivered messages to US phone numbers. Messages to most of Indian phone numbers are delivered properly
Seeing this error message. I think this means the phone number we provide to Twilio might be incorrect?

https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/14910496447771-Shutdown-of-Unregistered-10DLC-Messaging-FAQ#:~:text=Unregistered%20numbers%20were%20subject%20to,still%20apply%20to%20blocked%20messages.

From the support doc, I think the error is expected. We need to register our phone number
Can you confirm the source and destination countries?
10DLC rules differ from country to country, so we’ll need to know what we’re seeing there
Yea, for successful ones, the source is US, destination is IN. For unsuccessful ones, the source is US and the destination is also US
What were they specifically for that specific 10DLC you mentioned?
I want to drill into that one as a test case

The error message is "(Error: 30034) US A2P 10DLC - Message from an Unregistered Number". I think it is referring to *long codes (A2P 10DLC)*
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/360038173654-What-are-the-differences-bet[…]ort-codes-and-Toll-Free-numbers-for-messaging-to-US-Canada- (https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/360038173654-What-are-the-differences-between-long-codes-A2P-10DLC-short-codes-and-Toll-Free-numbers-for-messaging-to-US-Canada-)

I don't know much about long code vs short code phone numbers. I do notices that most of the 2fa code I got from other places uses short code (6 digit phone number), but instabase is using long code (+1 phone number)
Thank you, but for that specific error what is the source country and the destination country?
Given most of yesterday I’d expect US (+1 prefix) to India (+91 prefix) but I want to be sure
Both US for that error. Messages from US to IN are successfully delivered
Thanks, I’ll get started digging
Thank you!!

It looks like the messages are failing to deliver to the US numbers because we didn't finish registering the A2P campaign.

I'm setting up a sending service for that now and registering it to a campaign but in doing so it's asking for some information that I'll need, such as a couple of sample messages and a description of how users consent to opt-in to receiving messages.
